description: The height of a cell, as measured by the number of voxels that separates the bottom most and top most voxel in the segmented cell image converted to units of µm.
tooltip: The height of a cell, as measured by the number of voxels that separates the bottom most and top most voxels in the segmented image converted to units of µm.

description: The volume of a cell, as measured by the sum of individual volumes of segmented voxels in the segmented cell image, in units of µm³.
tooltip: The volume of a cell, as measured by the sum of individual volumes of segmented voxels in the segmented cell image, in units of µm³.

description: The surface area of a cell, as measured by the sum of individual outer surface areas of segmented voxels (facing the background) in the segmented cell image, in units of µm².
tooltip: The surface area of a cell, as measured by the sum of individual outer surface areas of segmented voxels (facing the background) in the segmented cell image, in units of µm².

description: The height of the nucleus of a given cell, as measured by the number of voxels that separates the bottom most and top most voxel in the segmented DNA image converted to units of µm.
tooltip: The height of a nucleus, as measured by the number of voxels that separates the bottom most and top most voxel in the segmented DNA image converted to units of µm.

description: The volume of the nucleus of a given cell, as measured by the sum of individual volumes of segmented voxels in the segmented DNA image, in units of µm³.
tooltip: The volume of a nucleus, as measured by the sum of individual volumes of segmented voxels in the segmented DNA image, in units of µm³.

description: The surface area of the nucleus of a given cell as measured by the sum of individual outer surface areas of segmented voxels (facing the background) in the segmented DNA image, in units of µm².
tooltip: The surface area of the nucleus, as measured by the sum of individual outer surface areas of segmented voxels (facing the background) in the segmented DNA image, in units of µm².

description: The volume of the fluorescently labeled structure of a given cell, as measured by sum of individual volumes of segmented voxels in the segmented structure image, in units of µm³.
tooltip: The volume of the fluorescently labeled structure, as measured by sum of individual volumes of segmented voxels in the segmented structure image, in units of µm³.

description: Whether the segmentation contains the entirety of the cell boundary (only determined for cells in anaphase).
tooltip: Whether the segmentation contains the entirety of the cell boundary (only determined for cells in anaphase).

description: Whether a particular cell is currently in interphase or mitosis.
tooltip: Whether a particular cell is currently in interphase or mitosis.

description: Which of our 5 stages of the cell cycle (determined by the shape of the DNA) a given cell is currently in.
tooltip: Which of our 5 stages of the cell cycle (determined by the shape of the DNA) a cell is currently in.

description: All principal components (PCs) were z-scored by dividing the PC values by the standard deviation (σ) of that PC. The z-scored principal components are referred to as “Shape Modes” and the combination of the first 8 Shape Modes creates the 8-dimensional generative shape space. Variation in Shape Mode 1 corresponds to cell and nuclear height.
tooltip: All principal components (PCs) were z-scored by dividing the PC values by the standard deviation (σ) of that PC. The z-scored principal components are referred to as “Shape Modes” and the combination of the first 8 Shape Modes creates the 8-dimensional generative shape space. Variation in Shape Mode 1 corresponds to cell and nuclear height.

description: All principal components (PCs) were z-scored by dividing the PC values by the standard deviation (σ) of that PC. The z-scored principal components are referred to as “Shape Modes” and the combination of the first 8 Shape Modes creates the 8-dimensional generative shape space. Variation in Shape Mode 2 corresponds to cell and nuclear  volume.
tooltip: All principal components (PCs) were z-scored by dividing the PC values by the standard deviation (σ) of that PC. The z-scored principal components are referred to as “Shape Modes” and the combination of the first 8 Shape Modes creates the 8-dimensional generative shape space. Variation in Shape Mode 2 corresponds to cell and nuclear  volume.

description: All principal components (PCs) were z-scored by dividing the PC values by the standard deviation (σ) of that PC. The z-scored principal components are referred to as “Shape Modes” and the combination of the first 8 Shape Modes creates the 8-dimensional generative shape space. Variation in Shape Mode 3 corresponds to how much the cell and nucleus are tilted in z along the major axis of the cell.
tooltip: All principal components (PCs) were z-scored by dividing the PC values by the standard deviation (σ) of that PC. The z-scored principal components are referred to as “Shape Modes” and the combination of the first 8 Shape Modes creates the 8-dimensional generative shape space. Variation in Shape Mode 3 corresponds to how much the cell and nucleus are tilted in z along the major axis of the cell.

description: All principal components (PCs) were z-scored by dividing the PC values by the standard deviation (σ) of that PC. The z-scored principal components are referred to as “Shape Modes” and the combination of the first 8 Shape Modes creates the 8-dimensional generative shape space.  Variation in Shape Mode 3 corresponds to how much the cell and nucleus are tilted in z along the minor axis of the cell.
tooltip: All principal components (PCs) were z-scored by dividing the PC values by the standard deviation (σ) of that PC. The z-scored principal components are referred to as “Shape Modes” and the combination of the first 8 Shape Modes creates the 8-dimensional generative shape space.  Variation in Shape Mode 3 corresponds to how much the cell and nucleus are tilted in z along the minor axis of the cell.

description: All principal components (PCs) were z-scored by dividing the PC values by the standard deviation (σ) of that PC. The z-scored principal components are referred to as “Shape Modes” and the combination of the first 8 Shape Modes creates the 8-dimensional generative shape space.  Variation in Shape Mode 5 corresponds to elongation along the major axis of the cell and nucleus from the top view.
tooltip: All principal components (PCs) were z-scored by dividing the PC values by the standard deviation (σ) of that PC. The z-scored principal components are referred to as “Shape Modes” and the combination of the first 8 Shape Modes creates the 8-dimensional generative shape space.  Variation in Shape Mode 5 corresponds to elongation along the major axis of the cell and nucleus from the top view.

description: All principal components (PCs) were z-scored by dividing the PC values by the standard deviation (σ) of that PC. The z-scored principal components are referred to as “Shape Modes” and the combination of the first 8 Shape Modes creates the 8-dimensional generative shape space. Variation in Shape Mode 6 corresponds to how bean-shaped the cell and nucleus appear, and the orientation of the “bean” from the top view.
tooltip: All principal components (PCs) were z-scored by dividing the PC values by the standard deviation (σ) of that PC. The z-scored principal components are referred to as “Shape Modes” and the combination of the first 8 Shape Modes creates the 8-dimensional generative shape space. Variation in Shape Mode 6 corresponds to how bean-shaped the cell and nucleus appear, and the orientation of the “bean” from the top view.

description: All principal components (PCs) were z-scored by dividing the PC values by the standard deviation (σ) of that PC. The z-scored principal components are referred to as “Shape Modes” and the combination of the first 8 Shape Modes creates the 8-dimensional generative shape space. Variation in Shape Mode 7 corresponds to how pear-shaped the cell and nucleus appear, and the orientation of the “pear” from the top view.
tooltip: All principal components (PCs) were z-scored by dividing the PC values by the standard deviation (σ) of that PC. The z-scored principal components are referred to as “Shape Modes” and the combination of the first 8 Shape Modes creates the 8-dimensional generative shape space. Variation in Shape Mode 7 corresponds to how pear-shaped the cell and nucleus appear, and the orientation of the “pear” from the top view.

description: All principal components (PCs) were z-scored by dividing the PC values by the standard deviation (σ) of that PC. The z-scored principal components are referred to as “Shape Modes” and the combination of the first 8 Shape Modes creates the 8-dimensional generative shape space. Variation in Shape Mode 8 corresponds to how trapezoidal the cell and nucleus appear in z and the orientation of the trapezoid from the side view.
tooltip: All principal components (PCs) were z-scored by dividing the PC values by the standard deviation (σ) of that PC. The z-scored principal components are referred to as “Shape Modes” and the combination of the first 8 Shape Modes creates the 8-dimensional generative shape space. Variation in Shape Mode 8 corresponds to how trapezoidal the cell and nucleus appear in z and the orientation of the trapezoid from the side view.

description: Cells flagged as outlier either because structure volume was zero or by an automated bi-variate outlier detection algorithm.
tooltip: Cells flagged as outlier either because structure volume was zero or by an automated bi-variate outlier detection algorithm.

description: Cells that belong to the Baseline Interphase Dataset (full dataset minus mitotics cells and outliers).
tooltip: Cells that belong to the Baseline Interphase Dataset (full dataset minus mitotics cells and outliers).

description: Cells found within the 8D sphere.
tooltip: Cells found within the 8D sphere.

description: Cells at the edge of the colony.
tooltip: Cells at the edge of the colony.

description: Angle used to align the cell's longest axis with the x-axis.
tooltip: Angle used to align the cell's longest axis with the x-axis.

description: Name of the cellular structure that has been fluorescently labeled in each cell line
tooltip: Name of the cellular structure that has been fluorescently labeled in each cell line
